channel.title: BBC News - Wales
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Covid: Most of Wales' coronavirus rules to end Saturday
item.description: Nightclubs will be able to reopen, but face masks will still be needed in shops and hospitals.

item.title: Covid anti-vaxxers: 'Shut down fake news sites,' begs daughter
item.description: The woman says her parents have been fooled by conspiracy theories about Covid online.

item.title: Two days of rain and thunderstorms forecast for north and mid Wales
item.description: Homes could flood and roads close as they strike north and mid Wales, the Met Office has warned.

item.title: Covid: Wales follows travel rules changes despite criticism
item.description: Wales will replicate England's travel changes, but ministers say they were not consulted.

item.title: Covid: 16 and 17-year-olds in Wales could get jab before term starts
item.description: Invitations for 16 and 17-year-olds could be sent in the coming days, the health minister says.

item.title: 'Wrexham - the club and the community are incredible'
item.description: Hollywood star Ryan Reynolds is ‘very, very excited’ to be co-owner of Wrexham, with the new season fast approaching.

item.title: Logan Mwangi: Mum and step-dad in court over death of boy, five
item.description: John Cole, 39, is charged with murdering his step-son, five-year-old Logan Mwangi.

item.title: South Wales Police gets more 999 calls than ever before
item.description: There has been "unprecedented" demand, with 24,265 emergency calls in July.

item.title: Former Wales and Lions full-back Terry Davies dies
item.description: Former Wales and British and Irish Lions full-back Terry Davies dies at the age of 88.

item.title: Thatcher helped climate by closing coal mines, says Boris Johnson
item.description: Boris Johnson's comments on carbon reduction during his Scottish trip are attacked by Labour and the SNP.

item.title: I'm A Celebrity: Work planned on Gwrych Castle ahead of ITV return
item.description: Councillors will debate alterations to the Grade I-listed building ahead of the show's return.

item.title: Covid lockdown easing: What are people looking forward to in Wales?
item.description: As most restrictions end in Wales on Saturday, weddings, events and socialising are back.

item.title: Smartphone app creates clever way to monitor patients
item.description: Evan Dobson is taking part in a 12-week trial of an app to monitor his heart condition.

item.title: Low carbon house: Green energy saves one resident £100 a month
item.description: To tackle a housing shortage and greenhouse gases, 20,000 low carbon homes are being built.

item.title: Climate change minister skied to school in Canada
item.description: Julie James talks about her childhood growing up in Canada, the United States and Wales.

item.title: 'Witnessing my mum be abused by her ex-partner'
item.description: Betty Harper, 19, wrote a song the night her mum, Natasha, was beaten by her then-partner.

item.title: Russell Martin: Swansea City boss says he has been told club will make signings
item.description: New Swansea City boss Russell Martin has been assured by the club's owners he will be given funds to strengthen his squad.

item.title: British and Irish Lions: Ken Owens proud of first start in South Africa series decider
item.description: Wales hooker Ken Owens will finally make his first British and Irish Lions Test start on Saturday in the series decider against South Africa in Cape Town.

item.title: Kieffer Moore: Cardiff boss Mick McCarthy happy at lack of interest in Wales striker
item.description: Cardiff City manager Mick McCarthy says he is "surprised," and "delighted," the club have not received interest in Wales striker Kieffer Moore.

item.title: The New Saints 4-2 Viktoria Plzen
item.description: Declan McManus' hat-trick gives The New Saints a great chance of reaching the Europa Conference League play-offs with victory over Viktoria Plzen.

item.title: Rugby League World Cup 2021 postponed until 2022 following withdrawals
item.description: The Rugby League World Cup in England is postponed until 2022 following the withdrawal of defending champions Australia, and New Zealand.

item.title: Diddymu cyfyngiadau wrth symud i lefel rhybudd sero
item.description: 15 mis ers y cyfnod clo cyntaf, bydd y rhan fwyaf o gyfyngiadau coronafeirws Cymru'n cael eu llacio ddydd Sadwrn.

item.title: Y dwbl i Lleucu Roberts wrth ennill y Fedal Ryddiaith
item.description: Y dwbl eto i Lleucu Roberts sydd wedi cipio'r Fedal Ryddiaith a Gwobr Goffa Daniel Owen yn yr un Eisteddfod.

item.title: Cyhuddo tri o bobl yn dilyn marwolaeth bachgen mewn afon
item.description: Cafodd Logan Mwangi, oedd yn bump oed, ei ganfod yn Afon Ogwr yn gynnar fore Sadwrn.

item.title: Brwydr y Bandiau: Pwy yw'r pedwar olaf?
item.description: Dod i adnabod bandiau rownd derfynol Brwydr y Bandiau 2021.

item.title: Cyngres Europa: Y Seintiau Newydd yn trechu Plzeň
item.description: Buddugoliaeth i'r Seintiau yng Nghyngres Europa yn erbyn Viktoria Plzeň o'r Weriniaeth Tsiec.
